reviews.text: We usually stay at the Roal champagne but decided to try this hotel for a change. No, it doesnt have the fantastic views of Roal Champagne or the swanky restaurant - but it is in a far superior location - right next door to Mercier. Staff are very friendly and rooms need to be seen to be believed. All are individually designed and have fantasic bathrooms - ours had an enormous roll top bath. One has a little courtyard just outside where we enjoyed a very reasonably priced bottle of house champagne in the sunshine. The staff reccommended a great little restaurant in town which we got a taxi to and walked back from. Highly reccomended. Enjoy.
reviews.title: Fantastic - better rooms than Royal Champagne

reviews.text: When looking for somewhere outside Paris for a 2 night stay we happened, quite by luck, on this lovely hotel. We were looking for a romantic little hotel in a gorgeous area of the country - we found it. The fact that we love champagne made it so much the better - there's 15 champagne houses to walk past before you get to the hotel, invluding some of the most famous names in the world. It's an easy walk to the hotel from the station so you don't need a car. And the Le 7 Bistrot we were recommended by the receptionist was so nice we went there both nights of our stay.
reviews.title: A wonderful find

reviews.text: This hotel is located right on the edge of town just as you pull into Epernay...we walked into town and back for dinner, but cabs or driving would be very easy as well. it is an easy 5 min. walk to Perrier Jouet and Moet & Chandon, not to mention many other Champange houses along the way.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Champange

reviews.text: The staff is AMAZING at helping with local knowledge and dinner reservations...there is a great restaurant (les caves a champange?-15 min walk into town) that has a menu deal with the hotel...45 Euro for 4 courses paired with 4 different champanges...it was great!
reviews.title: beautiful and charming

reviews.text: They were installing a pool while we were there, so the hotel continues to get better and better, breakfast was very similar to other French hotel offerings but still good, a nice sunny room that will shortly lead to the new pool...besides the major "trendy" champange houses in Epernay, it is a very easy drive to get to the smaller communities that really make up the soul of Champange. Thank you Villa Eugene, we will be back.
reviews.title: Sublime
Great hotel - great staff!
reviews.text: My family and I was visiting the Champagne region in week 7 2006 and had planned for a 2 nights stay in Epernay, before moving on to Reims. However, we were captured by this newly opened hotel which resides very convinient on the beautiful Avenue du Champagne in a totally renovated property formerly build and owned by the great Champagne producer Eugene Mercier (hence the name). The new owners have done a remarkable job of restoring the building and at same time maintain the special atmosphere that has been generated over the years by this very succesfull family. Our room where spacious, very clean and full equipped with all that the turist - or business traveller - requires. Even though it faced the Avenue du Champagne we where not bothered at all by noise from the street. The staff of the hotel where highly customer focused and nice in a special pleasant way. They spoke perfectly english and all of the time during our stay we felt welcomed and treated specially. We will strongly recommend staying at this hotel when visiting Epernay and we made bookings to revisit in Spetember 2006. By then it will be interesting to see the bar and the pool which are planned to be added to this nice hotel. This will really allow the guests to fully absorb and enjoy the history, atmosphere and beauty of the place.
A new hotel that was opened in mid 2005, Villa Eugene is a very special place to stay if you are planning to visit Champagne.
reviews.title: Superb hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is quite simply the best hotel I have stayed in for the money. We paid only 100 euros a night and we had a fabulous, sunny room with lots and lots of light. The staff are so friendly, the breakfasts are delicious, and the hotel is within walking distance of all the champagne houses. The hotel is Mercier's old mansion so it has lots of character but has been newly renovated so it is in good condition.
reviews.title: Quite simply the best hotel I have ever stayed in

reviews.text: I didn't think much of Epernay to be honest though. The surrounding towns are much cuter. For some reason I was expecting better restaurants and more luxurious or charming champagne houses whereas a lot of the places seemed very run down and undervisited without much imagination or creativity going into their design. At times I felt like I was drinking champagne in an RSA pub rather than in a champagne house. The wine tours in New Zealand or Australia seem to have much more taste or style to them.
reviews.title: Stylish and stunning!

reviews.text: My husband, myself and two other close friends had the pleasure of staying at La Villa Eugene last weekend. The hotel is perfectly situated on the Avenue de Champagne next to the House of Mercier which makes finding it easy.
reviews.title: Exceeded Our High Expectations
Great base for visiting Champagne
reviews.text: We have been bringing groups of TVR sportscars to the Champagne Region for the past four years and were looking for a special location as we are planning a 60th Anniversary celebration in 2007. As we drove into the car park the reception staff came out and asked if we were happy with the parking arrangements for our cars. The electric gates mean that at night the hotel can only be accessed by code carrying guests.

reviews.title: Magnificent Eugene
reviews.text: We were warmly wecomed and then given a tour of the hotel and our rooms (lift to all floors). Each room is different and has its own unique style. The reception staff will organise champagne house visits, taxis and restaurant bookings so that your stay is as memorable and relaxing as possible.
